summary:
Systems' Philosophy underpins my approach. Looking at issues, problems, anything at all - from a wide perspective of view points means that projects are more inclusive and outcomes much broader..

Marketing and professional development, followed by management courses to underpin the experience, leading to a Bachelor of Science Honours'​ Degree taken when I was in my early thirties. Working with Logica, the Systems'​ Integrator, in the mid nineties, to SME's for e-Commerce advising and practical administration set-up expertise, I eventually took a London  Trinity four-month TESOL Certification in order to be qualified to teach English to speakers of other languages. This enabled me to give English-language professional presentation courses, one to one, to lady executives in the IT/ Systems'​ Industry (in Madrid)  given my business background and experience.

I can offer personal development training for the basic CV as well as tutoring and elocution for personal, verbal presentations, in the English language. 'Learn your own story well, and practice its delivery in English;  you will be able to present yourself without having to use copious notes.  Short, medium and longer versions at your own fingertips so that you are never stumped for words when someone asks you to give an impromptu personal introduction'. Know Thyself. Be quietly confident.

school.name: DeMontfort University and Leeds Metropolitan University

education.field_of_study: Systems' Philosophy and Business; Organisational Psychology

profile_positions.description: Eclectic thinker outside of the norms and the boxes in which I do not fit. Whose labels do we wear? Who do we think that we are? How does our conditioning through culture, education, institutionalisation keep the systems as they are?  Is there any wonder that we keep waging war based on labels and narrow prejudicial conditioning? How do we become mindfully mindless inside of this context?
profile_positions.title: Reiki .. Yoga....Holistic Energy Studies...Seeker

profile_positions.description: Compassion is the way forward. Let us not leave the world to politicians and trade and war mongers. Let us take our responsibilities seriously and begin with ourselves; let us individually  learn how to spread the compassion that the world needs, inside us, outside of us and in our local place of living. We do not need to run to the other side of the world, we can do it here, in our houses and in our streets. The International Charter for Compassion needs all of us.
profile_positions.title: Charter for Compassion Signatory/ Holistic Analyst of Systems - Wider perspectives

volunteer_experiences.role: Parish Council - Lead fight against development of greenbelt in late  nineties in Northamptonshire
volunteer_experiences.description: Research of Planning Laws; compilation of project file; preparation of leaflets for villagers and public speaking to generate support. Media and political lobbying.

volunteer_experiences.role: Helping people in form-filling for benefits based on personal right, or means-tested.
volunteer_experiences.description: Older or younger, physically or mentally challenged people face a nightmare when it comes to form-filling and endeavouring to secure what might be their right; but only if they can produce the 'right'​ profile. I am appalled at the UK governmental approach to make these forms so complicated, with 'specific' terms sought that the ordinary, honest individual would not understand and, therefore, innocently lose rightful benefits. No wonder that there are so many unclaimed benefits.  Have you ever seen any of the forms?  I have - they can be in excess of twenty pages with phrases and directions which are nasty and narrow;  in short, designed to deceive and cut people off. And it is only getting worse.

skills: Teaching English as a Foreign Language
International Charter for Compassion Trainings and workshops
